title: Young Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy
Interview Descriptions: Quick call with communications manager. Applied for Young Ambassador position. Received interview invite within 1 week. Mostly behavioral questions. Was asked about my interests and why I applied for this job.
Interview Questions: What global events am I interested in

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy (Beijing, Beijing) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: One round of content/position specific interviews with potential supervisors, about 30 minutes, some questions asking your opinion on US-China relations, a few short answer questions related to US-China relations, took a couple of weeks.
Interview Questions: questions regarding your experience and knowledge of US-China matters

title: Young Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back interview with the potential supervisor. Was during covid so the interview was conducted over the phone. Experience-based, some questions asking your perspectives on US-China relations, why the CTC YAP program, etc.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a Carnegie-Tsinghua Young Ambassador?

title: Media Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy (Chongqing, Chongqing) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions:
First round with HR: general questions: tell me about a time you led a project, how do you manage time etc.

second round with team leader. More specific questions on social media copywriting. There was also a written test that asks you to write social media copies for an article published by any of the Carnegie think tank offices.
Interview Questions: What was a project that you have led before?

title: Programs and Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: One round HR/behavioral interview; one round content/position specific interview. First one was quite short, around 15-20 minutes, second one was longer probably around 30 minutes and more substantive and content-heavy.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy
Interview Descriptions: First round phone interview with the Operations Coordinator. Second round will be with a center staff who will probably be your advisor. Keep in mind that process takes a very long time - got my final result in mid May, and the first interview happened a month after the application was due.
Interview Questions: Why CTC? What scholar are you most interested in working with and why? What's the most pressing issue facing China right now?

title: Global Summer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Carnegie-Tsinghua Center for Global Policy in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was made aware of the internship opportunity by a professor of mine who had worked with the CTC's director in the past. After I submitted my initial application (several short answer questions related to Sino-U.S. communication/relationship growth in addition to the typical work experience queries) and followed up with the contact person, I had a Skype interview with the head of Operations, and the director's full-time Research Assistant. I was then asked to submit a writing sample and references.
Interview Questions: What do you think is the most pressing issue facing Sino-U.S. diplomatic relations right now?
